articles.title: Children told to stay home from school if sick amid flu, Covid and scarlet fever - BBC
articles.description: The advice to parents at the end of the Christmas break comes amid high levels of flu and Covid cases.
articles.content:
Parents in England are being urged to keep children off school if they are unwell and have a fever, amid high levels of flu and Covid-19 cases.
The same applies for nurseries, according to advice fr… [+2469 chars]

articles.title: 'Lemsip shortage' hits Britain as shoppers say they can find any cold and flu medicines on shelves - Daily Mail
articles.description: As the rate of Covid-19 and flu cases continues to soar across Britain, pharmacies have seen a huge spike in under-the-weather people seeking seeking remedies.
articles.content:
Desperate Brits are scrambling to find supplies of cold and flu medicines amid a surge of seasonal illnesses which is 'flooring' people this winter.

articles.title: COVID-19 Virus Found in the Brain: Autopsies Reveal Startling New Information - SciTechDaily
articles.description: An analysis of tissue samples from the autopsies of 44 people who died with COVID-19 shows that SAR-CoV-2 virus spread throughout the body—including into the brain—and that it lingered for almost 8 months. The study was published on December 14 in the journal…
articles.content:
ByJim Wappes, University of MinnesotaJanuary 2, 2023

articles.title: Mother warns parents of her daughter's 'sunburn-like' Strep A symptoms which left doctors stumped - Daily Mail
articles.description: Sadie Learmonth said her daughter Khloe (pictured), six from Irvine, North Ayrshire, Scotland, was struck with Strep A in September - and doctors were unable to diagnose her for weeks.
articles.content:
A Scottish mother has revealed her six-year-old daughter looked 'sunburned' and broke out in a 'head to toe rash' as an unusual symptom after she contracted Strep A.

articles.author: Diana Buntajova
articles.title: Woman, 35, diagnosed with stage 3 cancer after going to the toilet many times a day - Express
articles.description: Bowel cancer, also known as colorectal cancer, is considered the fourth most common cancer type in the UK, claiming more than 16,000 lives each year.
